intro: Solanum jabrense, commonly known as the Jabrense nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually purple or blue, with five petals, and it produces small, toxic berries that are not edible for humans. Due to its toxic properties, it is often found in shaded, moist environments and is of interest to botanists and ecologists.
